meanings.definition: To strike repeatedly, typically with the fists.
meanings.sent1: He pummels the punching bag in the gym.
meanings.sent2: The boxer pummels his opponent in the ring.
meanings.sent3: The little boy pummels his pillow pretending it's a monster.
meanings.sent4: The storm pummels the coast with strong winds and rain.
meanings.sent5: The drummer pummels the drums with great energy during the concert.

meanings.definition: To beat or thrash with force.
meanings.sent1: She pummels the dough to make it soft for baking.
meanings.sent2: The waves pummel the shore during the storm.
meanings.sent3: The chef pummels the steak to tenderize it before cooking.
meanings.sent4: The hail pummels the car, leaving dents all over.
meanings.sent5: The carpenter pummels the nail into the wood with a hammer.

meanings.sent1: The bullies pummel the smaller kids on the playground.
meanings.sent2: The enemy troops pummel the city with artillery fire.
meanings.sent3: The mosquitoes seem to pummel me every time I go outside.
meanings.sent4: The negative comments pummel her self-esteem.
meanings.sent5: The news of the scandal pummels the company's reputation.
